intro: Crepis palaestina, commonly known as the Palestine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region, including parts of Israel and Palestine. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has small, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Crepis palaestina is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
